main event: A bright white object with a ball of fire at each end, approximately 25 feet in diameter, was observed for 5 minutes as it passed overhead.
interesting points: The object appeared to start as a small light and gradually increased in size to the size of a basketball as it passed overhead.
The pilot in the area could not see the object.
The case was classified as 'insufficient data'.
Possible explanations included a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
There were two distinct men observed emerging from a 6 to 8 foot saucer-shaped object in a straight line cut of the saucer as though opened up.
sighted object: A bright white object with a ball of fire at each end, approximately 25 feet in diameter
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
